column4: Is it wrong to switch to root like one would in CentOS or Fedora instead of using sudo
just use sudo -s instead of enabling the root account.
Well I was using sudo -i usually

ya, your right. that's even more the root user because it'll load up the environment variables of the root user if it can. sudo -s just executes the default shell as root. (/bin/bash maybe?) It's used for using sudo over and over without actually switching to the root user.
